title: Hymn Board Font?
content:
See attached images.

I've done a fair bit of research, but can't find any information on the name of the font or it's origins. Any help or hints would be greatly appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [attendance-roster1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/typophile.com/files/attendance-roster1.jpg) | 153.39 KB |
| [TO5084-Dark.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/typophile.com/files/TO5084-Dark.jpg) | 1.16 MB |
| [fe85bc3525c5d57926d7a0926ea1adf5.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/typophile.com/files/fe85bc3525c5d57926d7a0926ea1adf5.jpg) | 17.79 KB |
author: Tom Kingdom

comments.content:
Type made for such boards or marquees doesn’t always have an equivalent in the metal type/phototypesetting/digital type worlds. It most likely had a basis in large wood type of the 19th century.

I found many similar fonts, but no spot-on matches. For the numbers, Octin Sports is very similar:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-sports/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-sports/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-sports/")

Some more options: [United Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection), [Hoboken Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Hoboken+High/Sans+Serif/), [Liberator](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=liberator), [Pop Warner](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.dafont.com/pop-warner.font), [Bou College](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.dafont.com/bou-college.font), [Jefferies](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.dafont.com/jefferies-jaynz.font), [Amarillo USAF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.dafont.com/amarillo-usaf.font), [High School USA Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.ffonts.net/High-School-USA-Sans.font), [LHF Old Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/oldblock.php), [Skin & Bones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.dafont.com/skin-bones.font) (distressed), [Vincent](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.pixelpixelpixel.com/2013/01/vincent-typeface), [Vehicle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/vehicle), [Directory Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/directory-board), [Abolition](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition), [Prohibition](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/prohibition), [Eriq's (Jaffe) Sports Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/eriqjaffe.50webs.com/)

EDITED--AGAIN:  
The large image shows a product as displayed by church supply houses such as Michigan Church Supply [http://www.michiganchurchsupply.com/-c-100\_842.html?sort=3d&page=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.michiganchurchsupply.com/-c-100_842.html?sort=3d&page=1 "http://www.michiganchurchsupply.com/-c-100\_842.html?sort=3d&page=1") I obtained the remaining numbers from that source and combined all numbers into a single number-set. I removed the white on black optical illusion which alters perception of weight and produced the following reference:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HymnsetBonW_5092.jpg)
  
I trust it will be helpful in selecting a substitute font where most letters would be a rough match for the casual reader.  
Octin College Semibold [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415143936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/") could perhaps be the closest. Too wide, but it has a similar weight and has angles inside the counters. Octin College is the same as Octin Sports [already suggested] but lacks the non-conforming serifs, except on \_1\_.  
Runner up: Directory Board JNL. It also has a similar weight and, but has rounded rather than angular corners inside the counters.  
Don
